relation: Description
Location
Exhaust system
Cooling water supply
Compressed air supply for the smaller machine
Electrical power
Resin storage
Hydraulic fluid spill management for the larger machine
Wheels/casters for easy relocation of machines
Status
West shop wall (proposed), East shop wall between kiln and paint storage(might not want paint above a 400+ degree tool) (proposed)- done
Note that what may appear to be a vent pipe with a red funnel is actually a chute for parts to fall down.
We do not expect to need a chiller, but we do expect to need open-loop or closed-loop room-temperature water flow.
Extend a line into the Mold shop
Overhead pendulum drop, 240V 18A 3PH rating on large hydraulic pump motor Heater power TBD, Smaller machine 110v
Some resin is in bins, some in paper bags, some in jugs.
Sheet metal pan under the machine (proposed), automotive oil pan until constructed.
Small machine heavy duty and lockable, the big machine has rubber feet for a reason, user death imminent!
Contact
Nate W
pageTitle: Difference between revisions of "Injection Molding Shop" - i3Detroit
textBeforeTable: Injection Molding Shop Infrastructure ToDo List Most importantly, if it stops being fun, make noise! Fail loudly! If you're not seeing the progress you want to see on your ToDo item, let people know, ask for ideas and help. Do as much (or as little) actual work on that item as your expertise and time allow. Help coordinate work on that ToDo item to avoid duplication of effort Keep track of the status of that ToDo item What am I promising to do if I put my name in a "Contact" box? Does it have a practical roadmap to reach success? Does it have the specific resources/expertise it needs? Is it making progress or is it stuck? Is the project making good use of the shop space it occupies? How can I help with the injection molding project? What do we need to do to make these machines a practical tool for our members? The intention of these ToDo lists is to maintain current answers to several different questions: ToDo List Notes Injection Molding Shop Consumables Consumables Arburg C4b Arburg ALLROUNDER 150 Equipment Think about what you are doing. If
textAfterTable: Injection Molding Shop Support ToDo List Description Status Contact Mold Design CAE (software tool chain?) Copy existing mold design (where to find examples?) Safety: Oil, resin, people near hot surfaces. Fluids under high pressure. Rapidly closing molds. Mold Fabrication Tool steel appears to be impractical for our shop. Forged/rolled Al plate (specialized mold alloy) proposed. Alumold 500 is available from Alro. Expect to get many hundreds of shots with a conservatively-designed mold made from the right aluminum stock. Process Control Temperature (two zones), pressure, cycle time, etc. Reading List Basics of Injection Molding Design Plastics Today Practical Guide to Injection Molding (on Google Books) Practical Guide to Injection Molding Project plans/status/info on i3 Detroit wiki First injection molding wiki page (this page) has been started Dave S.
